Name: Earl Grey MarTEAni
Ingredients: 60 ml Hayman's London Dry Gin tea infused
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Martini glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist.

INFUSE gin with black tea (preferably Earl Grey). Rather than infuse a whole bottle, you can instead pour just 120ml (4oz) dry gin (enough for two cocktails) into a small glass with one Earl Grey tea bag for 5 minutes at room temperature to achieve the desired flavour extraction. (Any longer and tannins can be overly dominant.)
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
EXPRESS lemon zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: A fantastic and very English cocktail created by a New Yorker. The gin botanicals combine harmoniously with the flavours and tannins of the tea.
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2000 by Audrey Saunders at Bemelmans Bar at the Carlyle, New York City.
Nutrition: One serving of Earl Grey MarTEAni contains 192 calories
